underweight.title: Health Suggestions for Underweight:
suggestions: Increase Caloric Intake: Focus on nutrient-dense, high-calorie foods such as nuts, seeds, whole grains, and lean proteins.
Balanced Diet: Include a variety of foods to ensure you're getting enough vitamins and minerals, especially iron and vitamin B12.
Strength Training: Incorporate weight training into your routine to build muscle mass.
Frequent Meals: Eat smaller, more frequent meals throughout the day to increase calorie intake.

normal.title: Health Suggestions for Normal Weight:
suggestions: Maintain a Balanced Diet: Continue consuming a balanced diet with an emphasis on whole foods like vegetables, fruits, lean proteins, and healthy fats.
Regular Exercise: Engage in a mix of cardio and strength training to maintain cardiovascular health and muscle tone.
Stay Hydrated: Drink plenty of water to maintain hydration.
Monitor Your Weight: Keep track of your weight to ensure it stays within the normal range.

overweight.title: Health Suggestions for Overweight:
suggestions: Focus on Portion Control: Watch your portion sizes and try to eat more nutrient-dense, lower-calorie foods like fruits and vegetables.
Increase Physical Activity: Aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise per week, including both aerobic and strength training.
Limit Processed Foods: Reduce intake of high-calorie, low-nutrient foods such as sugary drinks and fast food.
Consider a Balanced Diet Plan: Consult a nutritionist or dietician for a personalized meal plan.
